main: ^Welcome back. As you have all heard...
^No, no Jordan. Let's read it out:
^"Medicare's newly appointed Secretary of Health and Human Services has released his plans for reformation in healthcare.
^This plan includes privatizing medical services that are under universal coverage.
^The secretary claims that this change will provide a better quality of care and reduce taxes.
^This change is currently receiving mixed feelings from the public."
^Come on, Avery, this is hardly a joke anymore.
^Hey, hey, relax, this is good, Jordan. We spend more per capita than other countries and still rank average at best in healthcare performance.
^We don't even know the specifics. Heck, will we be able to afford a change like that? Private for-profit clinics?
^Ya' know a lot of clinics now are for-profit.
^Insurance doesn't cover everything, Jordan, but for what a lot of it does cover, we wait longer and the care is inefficient.
^It may take some personal coin, but it's something I'm wiling to spend money on.
^It's my life we're talking about here.
^People who work hard should reap the benefits of their drudgery.
^Not sure that's exactly something we can value as a nation, Avery.
^So what exactly do we value as a nation?
